tweet:
Proud to stand alongside so many friends, neighbors, and fellow Long Islanders during this morning's rally against anti-semitism and hate in Great Neck.

Thank you to all who came out and joined us! It was such an amazing and moving display of solidarity by this community. pic.twitter.com/yPL1HRe7Wi

.@NassauExecutive and I spoke with an amazing class of @32BJSEIU members who are preparing to take their citizenship test in the coming months.

Had a great discussion about civic engagement, government and their plans for the future.

Wishing them all the best of luck! pic.twitter.com/ACHXCfHZGr

Had a great time the at @sewanhakahs district-wide Model UN Conference this morning.

So impressed by their passion for global affairs and their commitment to addressing the urgent issues facing our world today. 

We're lucky to have these future leaders in @NY04! pic.twitter.com/GNIwEOTocX
I'm proud to have the transgender pride flag up in my office this week. #TransVisibilityWeek #TDOV pic.twitter.com/eOiAt2fWKO
This Vietnam War Veterans Day we honor those who served and sacrificed for our country more than 40 years ago. Today makes me proud to serve our nation's veterans.
"Very soon" can't come soon enough. https://twitter.com/kylegriffin1/status/1111434060457349125 …

This is wrong, misguided and cruel, but sadly, not at all surprising given @SecNielsen's shameful track record at DHS.

Needless to say, we are not going to let this happen. https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/immigration/dhs-ask-congress-sweeping-authority-deport-unaccompanied-migrant-children-n988651 …

.@AOC, come by and say hi to Luca any time! 

As of this week, he's potty-trained (sort of) and no longer destroys shoes and clothing (also sort of). https://twitter.com/pennstatetom/status/1111326441935958016 …
Lucky to serve with so many incredible women on @HomelandDems! https://twitter.com/HomelandDems/status/1111324500304510976 …

Proud to support #HR9, which will keep the US in the Paris Climate Accord & force the Trump Admin to take real action to curb carbon emissions. Climate change is the single greatest threat facing our planet, our country & Long Island. We cannot wait. We need to #ActOnClimate now! https://twitter.com/USRepKCastor/status/1110945532120162304 …

I also want to thank @alzassociation and my colleagues in the House and Senate who joined me in introducing this bipartisan bill. Thank you @RepMaxineWaters, @RepPeteKing, @RepChrisSmith, @RepStefanik, @RepDavidTrone, @SenatorCollins, @SenBobCasey, @SenCapito, & @DougJones! 4/4

I want to thank Karen Henley, a #NY04 constituent who has been a tireless leader on this issue. Her family's experience with this devastating disease and their advocacy have played such an important role in shaping this legislation. Thank you, Karen and Bandon! 3/4 pic.twitter.com/fWYTy537kR

Too often, Americans living with younger-onset Alzheimer’s disease and their families/caregivers are denied access to vital, federally-funded services simply because they're under the age of 60. That's not right and my bill would fix this. 2/4

Today I introduced the Younger Onset Alzheimer’s Disease Act, which will ensure that people living with younger-onset Alzheimer's have access to the critical support they need and deserve under the Older Americans Act. 1/4 https://kathleenrice.house.gov/news/documentsingle.aspx?DocumentID=456 …

Enjoyed meeting with my #NY04 friends from @AIPAC yesterday! Had a great discussion on the importance of a strong, bipartisan US-Israel relationship and my commitment to a safe and secure Israel. pic.twitter.com/Q6vndUBjv5

It’s 2019 and women in America still make, on average, 80 cents for every dollar earned by a man.

That's why I’m proud to join every House Democrat in cosponsoring the Paycheck Fairness Act, which will finally ensure that women receive #EqualPayForEqualWork.

I sent a letter to @ICEgov about this last year. Clearly, they've done nothing since to improve conditions for LGBT migrants.

@HomelandDems will be following up. We're not going to let this go. https://wapo.st/2FzPJqs

Today @HouseDemocrats introduced legislation to protect people with pre-existing conditions, lower premiums and reverse President Trump's attacks on a healthcare system that millions of Americans rely on.

I'm proud to support this bill. #ProtectOurCare https://nyti.ms/2YorEdj

Honored to gavel in my first hearing as Chair of the @HomelandDems Subcommittee on Border Security, Facilitation, and Operations.

Today, our committee will be hearing from experts on the border about the negative impacts of the Trump Administration's #familyseparation policy. pic.twitter.com/rnugJSg7UD

President Trump is turning his back on every American who relies on the ACA for healthcare, including the millions living with pre-existing conditions.

Completely shameful. https://politi.co/2Orvjmf

Horrified by this morning's rocket attack in Israel. I'm sending my prayers to all those who were injured. The US stands by our ally in the face of this violence and we must reaffirm our commitment to lasting peace in the region.
DOJ must release the underlying evidence in this investigation as well as the entire report so that Congress can determine the appropriate and necessary next steps. 2/2

The American people deserve full transparency. The Special Counsel explicitly declined to exonerate the President of obstruction and yet Attorney General Barr provided us with little more than a brief summary of his own conclusions. He owes the public more information. 1/2

There are 15,000+ #Dreamers, #TPS holders and #DED recipients who call #NY04 home.

They are our friends, neighbors, co-workers, and classmates.

That's why I’m proud to support #HR6. Because these hardworking families deserve a path to citizenship now. https://twitter.com/CAPimmigration/status/1108717987299819521 …

Great meeting with @MomsDemand yesterday. We discussed the dire need to get #HR8 and #HR1112 passed in the Senate and signed into law!

The fight for commonsense gun reform is far from over and we're lucky to have this incredible organization in our corner! pic.twitter.com/5SomsfZ6gZ

It's always great to sit down with @MaketheRoadNY.

Had a chance to discuss some of the pressing issues facing Long Island's immigrant community and the urgent need to pass #HR6, which will give Dreamers, TPS recipients, & DED beneficiaries the path to citizenship they deserve! pic.twitter.com/QtzyZkpZq1

Had the pleasure of meeting with Linda & Michael Beigel Schulman today, who lost their son Scott Beigel at Parkland.

Their tireless advocacy for gun reform has already made an incredible difference. Linda & Michael are an inspiration and I'm so grateful for everything they do. pic.twitter.com/O9yilAB2kF

Great discussion this morning at our clergy breakfast in Westbury! Touched on some critical issues affecting our community including affordable housing, education, immigration & gun violence.

Thank you to all who came! Looking forward to continuing these important conversations! pic.twitter.com/yFOGwP5muP

Such a wonderful initiative here in #NY04.

This program strengthens our community and helps us celebrate our incredible diversity. I look forward to seeing more schools participate! https://www.newsday.com/long-island/education/westbury-middle-school-islam-mosque-1.28664595 …
Happy #StPatricksDay  to everyone celebrating in #NY04 and across the country!

Speaking truth to power is never easy, and we need to ensure that the courage of whistleblowers is never taken for granted.

I'm proud to support this resolution. https://twitter.com/RepSpeier/status/1106621324649250816 …

Heartbroken about the news coming out New Zealand today. I'm praying for the victims, their families and the entire Muslim community there. This was an act of terror and hate and the United States must speak out and stand up against the Islamophobia that fueled this attack.

Great seeing JoAnn Smith of @PPNChealth tonight!

So proud to support @PPFA and the incredible work they do in communities across this country! pic.twitter.com/VTexd8sT6k

Earlier this year NYS passed several important bills to strengthen LGBTQ protections.

Today, Congress will take action at the federal level! I'm proud to cosponsor the #EqualityAct, which will ensure the LGBTQ community has the same basic protections that all Americans deserve. pic.twitter.com/4X3me65JjN

Dreamers & TPS recipients are Americans in every way that counts and they're an essential part of the #NY04 community!

I'm proud to be an original cosponsor of #HR6 so we can finally give them the path to citizenship that they deserve! #ProtectTheDream pic.twitter.com/LJk1RA5GfP

This is an important story (and a testament to the value of good local journalism!) We're awaiting responses from @CBP on why and how this happened. 

Thank you for your reporting! https://twitter.com/MariNBCSD/status/1105165397190369282 …

Proud to do it! Thank you for all that your organization does for our community. 

I Look forward to continuing our work together!

I'm particularly proud to see one of my own amendments pass as part of this bill, which would ban Members of Congress and staff from serving on corporate boards. 

This was a long-overdue change that will finally close a massive ethics loophole in our laws. #HR1

The American people elected our new Democratic Majority to bring transparency & accountability to Washington. Today, we delivered on that promise by passing the #ForThePeople Act, a bold democracy & ethics reform package. #HR1

On #InternationalWomensDay I'm grateful for all the strong women who came before me & excited to see the next generation keeping up the fight and breaking down new barriers.

And this year I'm especially proud to be serving alongside this historic class of women in Congress!

My statement on H. Res. 183, an important resolution condemning anti-Semitism, bigotry against Muslims and all forms of racism and discrimination against minority groups. This is a time to stand together as Americans and reaffirm our commitment to these values. pic.twitter.com/2y96vsHD7o

OffenderS. FTFY

There are more than a few people in your party that this would apply to as well. https://twitter.com/JohnCornyn/status/1103675490374684673 …

Targeting US citizens, journalists & a US attorney as organizers & instigators. This is as un-American as you can get. 

It's getting hard to keep track of all the ways in which DHS is being mismanaged by this administration. This is why we need oversight. https://www.nbcsandiego.com/investigations/Source-Leaked-Documents-Show-the-US-Government-Tracking-Journalists-and-Advocates-Through-a-Secret-Database-506783231.html …

In today's hearing @SecNielsen stated the exact opposite. 

If she wasn't lying, then she simply doesn't know what's happening within her own agency. Either way, she isn't fit to serve in her position. She needs to resign. https://twitter.com/jimsciutto/status/1103442964431421440 …

This is a lie.

Lying to Congress under oath is a felony.

The last person who did that is going to prison. https://twitter.com/atrupar/status/1103318619944091648 …
Government agencies are responsible for the consequences of their policies. If @SecNielsen can't accept that then she has no business running DHS.

The Zero Tolerance policy led to family separations. Period. 

(See what I did there?) https://twitter.com/SpoxDHS/status/1103340713121665026 …

We need to make sure that our election security efforts address these attempts to target & trick our nation's veterans.

They fought to protect us, now we need to do the same for them!

Big thanks to #NY04 native @KrisGoldsmith85 for his advocacy and leadership around this issue! https://twitter.com/VetAffairsDems/status/1103041442673504262 …

Honored to speak at @iava’s press conference this morning where we discussed some urgent legislative priorities including burn pits, GI bill benefits and modernizing the VA’s motto. 

Excited to get to work on behalf of these incredible men and women! pic.twitter.com/fD3JPYGt5T

Incredibly insightful visit. Puerto Rico has come a long way since Maria, but there's still more work to be done. 

We need to remain committed to providing Puerto Rico with the resources and support it needs not just to rebuild, but to rebuild stronger. https://twitter.com/HomelandDems/status/1102632728103710721 …
Winter storm warning in effect for Long Island starting at 1:00 p.m. today with up to 6 inches of snow expected. Check for updates, stay off the roads & be safe! #NY04 https://nwsdy.li/2T9VwLH

Great turnout and lively discussion at our #TownHall in RVC!

Thanks to everyone who came out tonight! pic.twitter.com/IgwHnuwRN0
